intro: Flacourtia sulcata, commonly known as the rough-flowered flacourtia, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its serrated leaves and small, clustered flowers that range from white to pink in color. It produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Flacourtia sulcata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
